summary: This is an email chain from February 2020 within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the submission of nominations for the Attorney General's Awards. The chain includes a brief, cryptic mention of 'Epstein?' in one email, but the primary content is procedural guidance for award nominations.

persons.name: Urbanczyk, Peter
persons.context: Appears as a contractor in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, sending an email reminder about Attorney General's Award nominations.

persons.name: Luke U.
persons.context: Mentioned as someone to whom completed Attorney General's Award nomination packages must be sent for review.

events.title: Attorney General's Award Nomination Call
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York initiates the process for submitting nominations for the Attorney General's Awards, outlining categories and deadlines.

events.title: Email Mention of Epstein
events.description: An email within the U.S. Attorney's Office chain contains the single-word query 'Epstein?' in the subject line, indicating a possible consideration of the Epstein case for an award nomination.

locations.address: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
locations.context: Address of the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, mentioned in the signature block.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from February 2020 within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York concerning Attorney General's Award nominations.
One email in the chain contains the single-word query 'Epstein?' in the subject line, suggesting the office may have briefly considered the Epstein case or related personnel for an award.
The primary content is procedural, detailing deadlines and categories for award nominations, including awards for groups and individual AUSAs (Assistant United States Attorneys).
The document shows standard internal office communication regarding awards, with the mention of 'Epstein' being an anomalous, cryptic reference within that administrative context.
